ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned a large number of tactics to use when developing our performances for songs. Andrew is a strong proponent of not planning the whole song, but very thoroughly developing the context and your character so that you can experience the song naturally as they would. I really liked using that because it kept our performances live; we never did songs the same way twice but every time was effective.
I learned better techniques for acting, singing, and obviously acting while singing. This includes things like the 5 questions, psychological gestures, and tactics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought Andrew's tactics were great; we learned so many skills that we could use in our performances and it was so fun to sing in the class because every performance felt different. I do wish that we had gotten to do more songs total though; we only worked on about 3 songs before getting the SHEN recital music and I would have loved to have tried a few more.

It was always unclear if/when assignments were due, and I thought we would work on more than three songs over the semester, but overall I learned a lot about those songs and others by listening to my classmates perform.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely would recommend this class to anyone who is a musical theater performer or is interested in that art form. It's definitely a scary class because it asks you to be very vulnerable with your music, but it's a really awesome experience and you come away having learned so much. I now feel very confident taking on new pieces of music and developing my context and character for them. I'm also able to worry a bit less about 'doing it right,' and instead I'm able to focus on making my context detailed enough to make the song feel real in the moment. It's a very freeing and interesting style of performance.
Not super well organized. Some students were obviously more liked than others.

Its a really fun class that really can help you grow as a performer and as a student. You get pretty close to your classmates as well since its such a long class every week and you get to interact a lot.
